description: Build a real-time collaborative workspace platform with document editing, team management, and extensible blocks system - following Notion's proven architecture patterns.

frontend.rationale: Notion uses React for complex UI state management and real-time updates. TypeScript ensures code quality at scale.

backend.rationale: JavaScript ecosystem consistency and excellent WebSocket support for real-time features.

database.rationale: PostgreSQL for complex relational data and ACID compliance. Redis for real-time collaboration state and caching.

realtime.rationale: Proven WebSocket implementation with horizontal scaling support via Redis adapter.

storage.rationale: Scalable file storage with global CDN for images, documents, and media attachments.

auth.rationale: Enterprise-ready authentication with team management, SSO, and fine-grained permissions.

questions.text: What level of real-time collaboration do you need?

choices.label: Full workspace collaboration (Notion/Linear style)
choices.impact: Complex real-time system, presence indicators, live cursors

questions.impact: Determines WebSocket requirements and collaboration complexity

choices.label: Block-based content (Notion style)
choices.impact: Complex block system, extensible content types

questions.impact: Affects database design, editor complexity, and extensibility

questions.text: What team organization model do you need?

choices.label: Simple teams (basic workspaces)
choices.impact: Basic permission system, simple user management

choices.label: Enterprise organization (SSO, advanced admin)
choices.impact: Enterprise features, SSO integration, audit logs

questions.impact: Determines authentication complexity and permission system architecture

questions.text: Do you need an extensible plugin/integration system?
questions.impact: Requires plugin architecture, API design, and integration framework

metrics.userEngagement: Daily active users, time spent in app

risks.mitigation: Start with basic collaboration, use proven libraries like Yjs or ShareJS
Implement conflict resolution early, extensive testing with concurrent users
Focus on core workflows first, gather user feedback early and often
Implement virtual scrolling, lazy loading, and document pagination

successFactors: Intuitive user experience that rivals Notion
Fast performance even with large documents

competitorAnalysis.Linear: Issue tracking focus, excellent UX, developer-oriented
